Package com.nickbenn.onehundred.view

Interface GamePresentation<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of view object used to present game status and prompts. This will typically be the base type of view objects in the UI framework for which a specific implementation is intended—e.g. String for a console-mode implementation, javafx.scene.Node for a JavaFX implementation, JComponent for Swing, etc.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextGamePresentation
    public interface GamePresentation<T>
    Declares methods that will construct and return presentations of game status, move prompts, error messages, etc. Implementations of this interface are essentially display "strategies", using an instance of Game as the context, and constructing view objects suitable for presentation in the UI environment for which the strategy is implemented.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      T illegalMoveNotification​(Game game)
      Constructs and returns a view object suitable for notifying the user that the most recently attempted move was illegal/invalid.
      T movePresentation​(int move, String player)
      Constructs and returns a view object suitable for presenting the most recent move.
      T movePrompt​(Game game)
      Constructs and returns a view object suitable for presenting a move prompt to the user.
      T nextMoveNotice​(String player)
      Constructs and returns a view object suitable for presenting the next player to move.
      T stateRepresentation​(Game game, String playerOne, String playerTwo)
      Constructs and returns a view object for presenting the current state of game.

    • Method Detail

      • stateRepresentation

        T stateRepresentation​(Game game,
                      String playerOne,
                      String playerTwo)
        Constructs and returns a view object for presenting the current state of game.
        Parameters:
        game - Context instance of Game.
        playerOne - Identifier for the first player (the user).
        playerTwo - Identifier for the second player (the computer).
        Returns:
        View of current Game state.

      • nextMoveNotice

        T nextMoveNotice​(String player)
        Constructs and returns a view object suitable for presenting the next player to move.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to move next.
        Returns:
        View presenting next player.

      • movePresentation

        T movePresentation​(int move,
                   String player)
        Constructs and returns a view object suitable for presenting the most recent move.
        Parameters:
        move - Most recent move (number added or subtracted).
        player - Player that made the most recent move.
        Returns:
        View presenting most recently completed move.

      • movePrompt

        T movePrompt​(Game game)
        Constructs and returns a view object suitable for presenting a move prompt to the user.
        Parameters:
        game - Context instance of Game.
        Returns:
        View presenting prompt for next move.

      • illegalMoveNotification

        T illegalMoveNotification​(Game game)
        Constructs and returns a view object suitable for notifying the user that the most recently attempted move was illegal/invalid.
        Parameters:
        game - Context instance of Game.
        Returns:
        View presenting illegal move notification.
